abstract: Chalk up another win for Carl C. Icahn. Under pressure from the activist investor, the diversified holding company Temple-Inland announced Monday that it would spin off its real estate and financial services units and timberlands. Temple-Inland will instead focus on its packaging and building products, with proceeds from the sales to be distributed through a shareholder dividend and a debt restructuring, the company’s chief executive said in a conference call Monday morning.
lead_paragraph: Chalk up another win for Carl C. Icahn. Under pressure from the activist investor, the diversified holding company Temple-Inland announced Monday that it would spin off its real estate and financial services units and timberlands. Temple-Inland will instead focus on its packaging and building products, with proceeds from the sales to be distributed through a shareholder dividend and a debt restructuring, the company’s chief executive said in a conference call Monday morning.

headline.main: Amid Pressure from Icahn, Temple-Inland Plans Breakup
